topic.name: Welcome!
topic.content: Hello, and welcome to Stratos: The Sci-Fi Settlement Sim! This tutorial will walk you through the essentials of setting up a settlement, exploring the surrounds, dealing with potential threats, and establishing a sound economy.

topic.name: Navigation
topic.content:
First, you'll need to familiarise yourself with basic controls. Use the W, S, A and D keys to move your viewpoint forward, back, left or right.
(Note: You can also use the arrow keys, click on the ground, or click a position on the minimap in the top-left.)

topic.name: Navigation Done
topic.content: Well done! If you ever get lost, messages (such as this one) can always be accessed from the Messages listing on the left-hand side of the screen.

topic.name: The Bastion
topic.content:
Your settlement starts out with a single main building: The Bastion, which houses your family and personal servants, and serves as your seat of command for the settlement as a whole. As such, you should strive to protect the Bastion at all costs.
To do this, you will need to both identify any threats in the area, and take steps to establish defences, which is what we'll cover next.

topic.name: Place a Trooper Lodge
topic.content:
To hire troops and other personnel, you'll need to construct facilities to house them.
Open the Installations tab in the top-right of the screen. Select the Trooper Lodge, click build, and then place one next to your Bastion.

topic.name: Trooper Lodge Placed
topic.content:
Good work. Normally, buildings will take a while to construct and fully staff, but for now we'll speed things up and provide some starting recruits. If you like, you can click on the new building and take a look at the staff recruited.
The next step would be gain some information about the surrounds of our base. We need to know what's out there.

topic.name: Declare a Recon Mission
topic.content:
This is a unexplored area of the map- dark and unknown. There might be threats lurking unseen, or precious resources to be found...
Click here, and a small green icon should appear in the lower-centre of the screen. Press this to declare a Recon Mission, then increase the reward to attract applicants.

topic.name: Recon Mission Begun
topic.content: Good work. Your troopers should begin exploring the assigned area shortly. In the meanwhile, let's take a look at getting a basic economy up and running.

topic.name: Economy Basics
topic.content: Go the the Installations panel again, and place a Stock Exchange (under Commerce structures) and Engineer Station (under Engineer structures) close to your Bastion.

topic.name: Facilities Placed
topic.content: Excellent. The technicians at your Bastion should now begin constructing these facilities. Once that's complete, we'll provide some initial staff and move on to getting some cash flow going.

topic.name: Install Production Upgrades
topic.content:
Good work.
To improve their production of goods and range of services, many buildings can have upgrades installed.
Select the Engineer Station, open the Upgrade pane, and queue Assembly Line twice. Your construction staff will attend to it shortly, speeding up Parts manufacture. These can then be sold for a profit.

topic.name: Install Trade Upgrades
topic.content: You can also upgrade your Stock Exchange to make the most of any sales. Select the Stock Exchange and queue the Rations Vending and Hardware Store upgrades. This will increase space available to foodstuffs and building materials (e.g, parts), and generate extra profit from any purchases.

topic.name: Trade Setup Done
topic.content:
That should do it. It takes a little time for dropships to arrive and perform their transactions- typically once per day.
Once a sale is complete, on-duty auditors from your Bastion will drop by to record and file your profits and losses. The trick is to make sure you have more of the former.
In the meantime, let's take another look at base security.

topic.name: Destroy The Nearby Ruins
topic.content:
It looks as though your exploring troops have uncovered an Ancient Ruin close to your base. Structures such as these often harbour dangerous creatures who may assault your base and waylay colonists- as such, it's a good idea to raze them when found.
Select the Ancient Ruin and declare a Strike Mission (the small red icon underneath.) Then increase the reward high enough to attract soldiers to carry out the task.

topic.name: Strike Mission Begun
topic.content: Now that you have some applicants for the Strike Mission, they should polish off the ruins in short order. Take care, however- some of the inhabitants will defend themselves!

topic.name: Drones Destroyed
topic.content: Now that any local resistance has been dealt with, the ruins should fall in short order.

topic.name: Strike Mission Complete
topic.content: Excellent! Now that the ruins are destroyed, let's return to base.

topic.name: Hiring Basics
topic.content: Some veteran Troopers have applied to work at your Trooper Lodge, along with a senior Artificer at your Engineer Station. Open the facility's Staff tab- or the Personnel pane- to view their skills and traits. Then you can decide which candidates to hire.

topic.name: Troops Hired
topic.content:
That's it. Fresh recruits will arrive aboard visiting Dropships, along with trade goods. But they might not arrive for a while. If you like, you can open the facility's Staffing tab to get an ETA.
While we're waiting, let's take a fresh look at our cash flow.

topic.name: Profits and Loss
topic.content: At the moment, your funds are likely to be running low. We'll explore some methods of fixing that, but first you should open the Finance pane (first button in the top-right), and click on the Budgets tab. Then you can take a look at your profits and losses for each day.

topic.name: Expanding Industry
topic.content:
...Not too encouraging.
There are many ways to earn credits, but on a map like this, with large areas of barren rock and irradiated wasteland, heavy industry turns a faster profit. Place a second Engineer Station near your first, and an Excavation Site somewhere close to both.
Mining is most efficient near outcrops of surface rock, so keep an eye out for those when exploring. (You can also check the minimap.)

topic.name: Personal Housing
topic.content: While those are building, you may also want to start thinking about giving your citizens a few amenities, such as private housing. Your colonists will claim lots by themselves given time and space, but you can anticipate that by placing a Seal Tent or two in convenient locations. Try that now.

topic.name: Build a Supply Depot
topic.content:
Housing yields tax income, and will upgrade itself as more goods and services become available.
Finally, you may want to supplement your trade income by exporting surplus minerals from your Excavation Site. Place a Supply Depot to store raw materials and reserve them for trade.

topic.name: Watch and Learn
topic.content:
Good. We'll wait for any current construction to finish. All your expenses up to now have been covered for free, but from here on, you'll need to balance your own books.
This might be a good time to see what your Auditors are up to. Select the Bastion, go the Staff tab, and select one to see if any profits or losses are being filed.

topic.name: Time and Money
topic.content: Auditors will periodically assess profits and losses at nearby venues, tally the sum, and report back to you. Between imports, upgrades and hiring costs, it might take a day or two for your industry and trade venues to start turning a profit. You can wait if you wish, or- if you're ready- we'll turn our attentions back to handling external enemies.

topic.name: Base Under Attack!
topic.content: You asked for it! Here come two enemy Drones to raze your colony. Flag them with a Strike Mission ASAP and watch your Troopers handle it. Don't forget to up the reward.

topic.name: Find The Distant Ruins
topic.content:
Those creatures- known as Artilects- are still a threat, however. You will need to use Recon Missions to explore the surrounding terrain until you find the Ancient Ruins that spawned the Drones.
(Tip: Try searching in the same quadrant they came from.)

topic.name: Ruins Discovered
topic.content:
The Ruins have been found. Now destroy them.
This may be a tough fight. Consider building an extra Trooper Lodge or installing some upgrades at the first to hire more troops or improve their training.

topic.name: Ruins Destroyed
topic.content: From this point on, you're on your own. The only thing left to do is ensure your settlement has turned a profit, and you can be confident it's future is secure.

topic.name: Tutorial Complete
topic.content: Congratulations.
